title: How di I get reminders to work in Tasks?
content: When I create a task, I set reminders for say 5 minutes before. But they never 'fire'. Reminders for calendar events work and I know Thunderbird treats Events and Tasks somewhat the same, but I don't know how to get them to fire off. Thanks

title: Message composing & address field
content:
When I reply or forward an email (Thunderbird 182.12, MacBook Pro M3) with a keyboard shortcut and start writing right away, the initial characters are typed into the address bar and then only the focus switches to the main composition field.

This leads to some some other email addresses being selected depending on what the first few letters in typing are...

Is there any way that the focus is always first on the composition window and not the address bar?

Thanks a lot Harry

title: Thunderbird stuck on Place replies in the folder of the message being replied to, how to fix?
content:
Thunderbird 128.13.0esr (64-bit), Ubuntu Clean install a few months ago. I ave been using Thunderbird since (about) 2005. Love it.

When I create and send a message it is saved in the Sent folder, but when I reply to a message, the reply is saved in the folder of the message being replied to.

However, the option to "Place replies in the folder of the message being replied to" is unchecked, and the option to "Place a copy in: " Sent folder is checked. (I have tried both the 1st option: "Sent folder on..." and the 2nd option "Other..." Sent on... no difference.

So, Thunderbird seems to be stuck on Place replies in the folder of the message being replied to.

How do I fix this?
creator: mrc116

title: Deleted GMAIL account still pops up asking me to sign in
content: I had a school gmail account that was on my thunderbird program. After I graduated and the school deleted that account, thunderbird kept giving me a gmail pop-up to log into that account. I've gone to the settings to try and remove it, but the account email doesn't show up there. I've tried uninstalling and reinstalling the program, but didn't have any luck. Does anyone know how I can stop getting that popup?

title: Can't transfer old files to an installation on a new computer
content:
I had a disk crash on a Linux laptop and had to rebuild it from scratch. I have my entire home directory backed up, including the .thunderbird folder, and am now trying to use it by replacing that folder in my new installation with the back-up one as outlined in the instructions in the Thunderbird article about how to do this.

But after doing this, when I start Thunderbird, only the most recent IMAP download data comes up. None of the historical backed-up data is there.

Any advice you can offer will be appreciated.

title: Thunderbird incredibly slow to launch links when, clicked. Also incredibly slow to open a new message window, after a mailto is clicked.
content:
This has been a recurring issue that comes and goes with time.

It happened to me a few weeks ago, than I updated thunderbird and it disappeared.

Now I am on the latest version it is happening again.

Basically, if I click a mail two link in say firefox, it can take up to two minutes to create the new message in thunderbird.

Alternatively, if I am clicking a link in thunderbird, to launch a website in say, firefox, it can take considerable time for that link to launch as well.

I'm currently on debian 12, running the very latest thunderbird.

128.13.0esr (64-bit) Release notes Mozilla Thunderbird Flatpak en-USthunderbird-flatpak - 1.0

This is a problem I've never really been able to solve, so I'm asking here. Any help would be greatly appreciated, as it's massively impacting my workday.

Thanks again
creator: postaccount

title: Új üzenet nem nyílik meg
content:
A legújabb frissítés óta az új üzenetre kattintással nem történik semmi. Sem a Ctrl+N sem a fájl menü->új->üzenet. Csak akkor jön elő haegy meglévő üzenetben a válaszra kattintunk. TB újratelepítés, sfc /scannow, windows update, chkdsk, malware scan megtörtént. (win10)

Nekem frissítés hibának tűnik

Köszönöm!

title: Confirmation when deleting a message using the delete key?
content:
I'm looking for a way to confirm deletion of a message before deleting it. I often use the `Home/End` button on my keyboard and sometimes accidentally press `Delete` button. In that case, a message could be deleted without me even noticing.

I know about the add-on (https://github.com/caligraf/ConfirmBeforeDelete), but it has a lot of bugs and is not compatible with Betterbird

Any idea?

title: Moving a task from one calendar to another does not (can not) delete the original task. You have two copies of the same task in two calendars!
content: When I move a task on google mail for Android from one calendar to another, the task list on the Thunderbird desktop shows me two copies of the task! see image2 When I try to delete the original task in thunderbird desktop from the task list I get the prompt: see image1 When I change the calendar on the desktop, the same prompt occurs. I can delete the moved copy of the task from the new calendar, but the original task in the original calendar is undeletable! Clicking "Synchronize" for the original calendar doesn't change anything!
